p.i: You can also create server-side web applications with JavaScript. In this exercise, you create a small Node.js web application. Node.js is an open-source environment for developing server-side web applications with JavaScript.

ol.li: Open the page https://ondemand.cp.haaga-helia.fi and log in to the Linux desktop.
In the Linux desktop, open a Terminal window (select Applications > System Tools > Terminal)
On the Linux command line, set your own home folder as the current folder as follows: cd
Create a new folder as follows: mkdir myscripts
Set the new folder as the current folder as follows: cd myscripts
Create a new text file called mysimpleserver.js as follows: touch mysimpleserver.js
Open the text file in the gedit editor as follows: gedit mysimpleserver.js &

On the Linux command line, start your JavaScript server-side application as follows: node mysimpleserver.js
Your server-side application is now running and can be accessed by entering its web address into a web browser's address field.
In the Linux desktop, start a web browser and enter the following address into the web browser's address field: http://localhost:1337

What do you see on the web browser window?
Copy the text from the web browser window and submit it.

p.i: In the Terminal window, you can terminate your JavaScript server-side application by pressing ctrl-c
